w:r.w:t: The teacher will teach vocabulary words associated with things around a city. They will learn these words by using TPR, sentence frames, and vocabulary. Students will study these words and phrases: buildings, streets, corners, crosswalks, skyscrapers, tran
sportation, restaurants, this is, I take the, and I go to.
At the completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
Recognize, spell, and pronounce these target words associated with things around a city
Spell and pronounce common associated words
Use these sets of words in complete sentences
Students will be able to explain what something is and where they go
buildings, streets, corners, crosswalks, skyscrapers, transportation, restaurants, this is, I take the, and I go to
This slide will always be the
-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: “Today, we are going to be learning about things around your city.”
Complete the sentence frame by filling in the blank with the word “buildings”
Circle the buildings that you have seen in your city.
“I see a hospital. I see a police station. I see a fire station. I see a school.”
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Have the students circle the buildings that they see in their own city.
Ask the students: “What is a building?”
Ask the students: “Do you recognize any of these buildings?”
Ask the students: “Do you see any of these buildings in your own city?”
Draw a line under this building: police station
Draw a star next to this building: fire station
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Ask the students: “Do you have a hospital in your city? Have you been to the hospital in your city?”
Have the students underline the police
Ask the students: “Do you have a police station in your city? Have
you been to the police station in your city?”
Have the students draw a star next to the fire station.
Ask the students: “Do you have a fire station in your city? Have you been to the fire station in your city?”
Complete the sentence frame by filling in the blank with the word “
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Ask the students: “What street do you live on?”
Have the students write down the name of the street on the line.
Ask the students: “Are there a lot of streets in your city?”
Ask the students: “Where do the streets lead to?”
Draw a line on the street and take the truck to the Cafe.
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Have the students circle the orange
Have the students draw a line on the street and take the truck to the Cafe.
Ask the students: “What street should the orange truck take to get to the Cafe?”
Ask the students: “Is the street straight or curvy?”
Complete the sentence frame by filling in the blank with the word “
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Ask the students: “What is a street corner?”
Ask the students: “What do people do at street corners?”
Ask the students: “There are street lights at the street corner. The light is green. What does that mean?”
Complete the sentence frame by filling in the blank with the
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Ask the students: “What are the girl and dog doing at the street corner? What are they waiting for?”
Accept answers that capture the spirit of “cross the street”
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Have the students fill in the missing
Complete the sentence frame by filling in the blank with the word “
“Crosswalks are used to cross the street safely.”
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Ask the students: “What is a crosswalk?”
Ask the students: “Have you ever used a crosswalk in your city?”
Ask the students: “What are the vehicles doing at the crosswalk?”
Ask the students: “Why is it better to cross the street at a crosswalk?”
“The people are crossing at the crosswalk”
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Ask the students: “What are the people doing?”
Ask the students: “Why are they using the crosswalk?”
Ask the students: “When have you used a crosswalk? Where were you going?”
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Explain that skyscrapers are very tall buildings. Skyscrapers are usually in big cities.
Ask the students: “Are there skyscrapers in your city?”
Count the skyscrapers on the slide
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Ask the students: “Have you ever been in a skyscraper?”
Ask the students: “How would you get to the top of a skyscraper? Would you use an elevator or the stairs?”
Circle the appropriate picture and match to the sight word
Complete the sentence frame with the word “transportation.”
“People use transportation to travel in cities.”
“I see a car, I see a bus, I see a truck”
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Ask the students: “What type of transportation are these people using in the city?”
Ask the students: “Do you travel by automobile?”
Students will have seen these words in previous lessons in this Unit.
Complete the sentence frame with the word “buses”
“People use buses as a form of transportation”
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Ask the students: “What type of transportation are these people using in the city?”
Ask the students: “Do you travel by bus? Have you ever been on a bus?”
Students will have seen this word in a previous lesson in this Unit
Complete the sentence frame with the word “
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Ask the students: “What type of transportation are these people using in the city?”
Explain that a subway train is a train underground.
Ask the students: “Do you travel by subway train? Have you ever been on a
Students will have seen this word in a previous lesson in this Unit
Complete the sentence frame with the word “
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Ask the students: “What type of transportation is this person using in the city?”
Ask the students: “Do you travel by bicycle? Have you ever ridden your bicycle in the city? Where did you go?”
Complete the sentence frame with the word “
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Ask the students: “Do you see restaurants in your city?”
Ask the students: “Do you go eat at restaurants? How often to you go? What is your favorite restaurant?”
Complete the sentence frame with the word “restaurants”
Answer the teacher’s questions in complete sentences.
Ask the students: “What type of food do you like to eat at restaurants?”
Ask the students: “Would you rather eat dinner at home or in a restaurant? Why?”

Freeform “Show and Tell” Conversation Activity Slide
Draw a picture of your city. Include buildings and streets in your picture.
Have the students draw a picture of your
Have the students include buildings and streets in their
Ask the students about the different buildings in their picture. Ask the students about skyscrapers and restaurants in their city.
Word Wall Vocabulary Builder Activity – Slide 22
Students will read and spell their new words:
buildings, streets, corners, crosswalks, skyscrapers, transportation, restaurants, this is, I take the, and I go to.
The teacher will give feedback on the spelling and pronunciation of the new words.
